that's because worms taken oxygen

in a passive process called diffusion

outside their bodies to the lower

after a rainstorm worms can usually

water is a lot denser than air so

like up to a thousand times slower which
means that for a worm
it could be a lot harder to breathe

although some of that may depend on the

a common tropical worm uses relatively

that seems to be limited to night

last hypothesis
is that raindrops landing on the soil
